meanings.definition: To laugh in a restrained, nervous, or high-pitched manner.
meanings.sent1: She titters softly when she feels shy.
meanings.sent2: The children titters at the funny clown.
meanings.sent3: Her titters during the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The wind titters through the leaves like a mischievous sprite.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her titters echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: A series of short, high-pitched laughs.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with the titters of the audience.
meanings.sent2: His titters could be heard across the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The titters of the baby brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent4: The titters of the birds in the morning signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The titters of the students brightened up the classroom.
